p: Cancers and other neoplasms are still a significant health threat with high expenditure for cancer care, which in the USA in 2018 reached ca. 150 billion dollars. Moreover, cancer is still one of the leading causes of death worldwide, despite extensive research on new antineoplastic medications. In 2018, there were more than 18 million new cases and more than 9 million cancer-related deaths worldwide. Approximately 39.5% of men and women will be diagnosed with cancer at some point in their lives [ 52]. Regardless of the progress of science and medicine, there is a great need for new treatment options for these diseases. To fight this ubiquitous threat, scientists work on sophisticated strategies such as retrospection based on traditional medicine and herbal remedies, variations with light in photodynamic therapy, and nanomedicine.
